channel.title: Wont compile
channel.description:
when i compile i get this.....
'javac' is not recognized as an internal or external command, operable program or batch file. Press any key to continue . . .
any ideas?
coding has been so difficult since i stopped a while bak and my computer was formated for vista....
my compile edit-
@echo off javac *.java pause

item.title: Wont compile
item.dc:creator: @system system
item.description:
@system wrote:

If your having compiler problems and you cant fix it, try out the compiler i’m using its pretty good, just copy and paste:

@echo off
cls
title Toonshortys Compiler
:main
echo ------------------------------------------------------
echo Welcome to Toonshortys Compiler V2.0
echo This Compiler is for Java 1.6.0_01 to 1.6.0_04
echo Select an option below to begin
echo ------------------------------------------------------
echo c - Compile Server
echo r - Runserver
echo s - edit settins
echo ------------------------------------------------------
set /p select= Selection:
if %select%==c goto compile
if %select%==r goto run
if %select%==s goto settings
if %select%==C goto compile
if %select%==R goto run
if %select$==S goto settings
cls
pause

:compile
IF EXIST “%programfiles%\JAVA\JDK1.6.0_01\BIN” (goto compile1)
IF EXIST “%programfiles%\JAVA\JDK1.6.0_02\BIN” (goto compile2)
IF EXIST “%programfiles%\JAVA\JDK1.6.0_03\BIN” (goto compile3)
IF EXIST “%programfiles%\JAVA\JDK1.6.0_04\BIN” (goto compile4)

:compile1
cls
title Compiling…
echo Found: Java JDK 1.6.0_01
echo Compiling Server, Please Wait…
“C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_01\bin\javac.exe” -cp . *.java
pause
cls
goto main

:compile2
cls
title Compiling…
echo Found: Java JDK 1.6.0_02
echo Compiling Server, Please Wait…
“C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_02\bin\javac.exe” -cp . *.java
pause
cls
goto main

:compile3
cls
title Compiling…
echo Found: Java JDK 1.6.0_03
echo Compiling Server, Please Wait…
“C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_03\bin\javac.exe” -cp . *.java
pause
cls
goto main

:compile4
cls
title Compiling…
echo Found: Java JDK 1.6.0_04
echo Compiling Server, Please Wait…
“C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_04\bin\javac.exe” -cp . *.java
pause
cls
goto main

:run
cls
title Runserver
java -Xmx800M server
cls
pause

:settings
cls
echo Enter one of the following to change background colour…
echo —
echo B0 - Black
echo B1 - Blue
echo B2 = Green
echo B3 Cyan
echo B4 = Red
echo B5 = Purple
echo B6 = Yellow
echo B7 = White

echo Enter one of the following to change text colour…
echo —
echo T0 = Black
echo T1 = Blue
echo T2 = Green
echo T3 = Cyan
echo T4 = Red
echo T5 = Purple
echo T6 = Yellow
echo T7 = White

set /p s= selection:

if %s%== B0 (set b=0)
if %s%== B1 (set b=1)
if %s%== B2 (set b=2)
if %s%== B3 (set b=3)
if %s%== B4 (set b=4)
if %s%== B5 (set b=5)
if %s%== B6 (set b=6)
if %s%== B7 (set b=F)
if %s%== T0 (set t=0)
if %s%== T1 (set t=1)
if %s%== T2 (set t=2)
if %s%== T3 (set t=3)
if %s%== T4 (set t=4)
if %s%== T5 (set t=5)
if %s%== T6 (set t=6)
if %s%== T7 (set t=F)

color %b%%t%
pause
cls
goto main

Logged

[br][br][size=1]Posted on: March 02, 2008, 01:33:59 PM[/size][hr]Hope I helped…

Read full topic

item.title: Wont compile
item.dc:creator: @WINDOWS_M_DIA WINDOWS M£DIA
item.description:
@WINDOWS_M_DIA wrote:

[quote=“fr3sh_aka_clutch, post:3, topic:185786”][size=50pt]Chapter 7 - The error ‘The system could not find the path specified.’
By Tico135

Open up “My Computer”.

Click “View System information”

Click “Advanced”.

Click “Environment Variables”.

Under “User Variables” click “New”.

Name it “CLASSPATH” and for the “Variable Value” (only if you have JDK 6u1) put this in: CLASSPATH=C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_01\bin;%CLASSPATH%; If you have JDK 6u2, you must enter CLASSPATH=C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_02\bin;%CLASSPATH%; for the variable value.

Under “User Variables” click “New”.

Name it “PATH” and for the “Variable Value” (only if you have JDK 6u1) put this in: C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_01\bin If you have JDK 6u2, you must enter C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_02\bin for the variable value.

Click “OK”.

Click “OK”.

Your computer now recognizes Java.[/size][/quote]

you have to be the most annoying person on moparscape you queer

item.title: Wont compile
item.dc:creator: @fr3sh_aka_clutch fr3sh_aka_clutch
item.description:
@fr3sh_aka_clutch wrote:

Chapter 7 - The error ‘The system could not find the path specified.’
By Tico135

Open up “My Computer”.

Click “View System information”

Click “Advanced”.

Click “Environment Variables”.

Under “User Variables” click “New”.

Name it “CLASSPATH” and for the “Variable Value” (only if you have JDK 6u1) put this in: CLASSPATH=C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_01\bin;%CLASSPATH%; If you have JDK 6u2, you must enter CLASSPATH=C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_02\bin;%CLASSPATH%; for the variable value.

Under “User Variables” click “New”.

Name it “PATH” and for the “Variable Value” (only if you have JDK 6u1) put this in: C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_01\bin If you have JDK 6u2, you must enter C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_02\bin for the variable value.

Click “OK”.

Click “OK”.

Edit by Tico135: That size was unnecessary.

Your computer now recognizes Java.[/size]

Read full topic
